text: ` ` At no point was I notified or consulted about Ms. Thurman driving a car on camera that day,'' says coordinator Keith Adams. The stunt coordinator on the Kill Bill movies has broken his silence on a disturbing recent allegation made by Uma Thurman regarding a crash during production that left her injured. Coordinator Keith Adams told The Hollywood Reporter that he and his entire department were kept off set the day Thurman was allegedly pressured by director Quentin Tarantino to drive a rattrap convertible down a curved, sandy Mexican road at 40 mph, resulting in a crash that gave her a concussion, damaged her knees and could have caused worse injuries. ` ` No stunts of any kind were scheduled for the day of Ms. Thurman's accident,'' states Adams in an email to TH
